intro: Geum uniflorum, commonly known as the singleflower avens, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal leaves that are palmately lobed. The plant produces small, showy yellow to orange flowers in early spring, before its leaves emerge. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators like bees and flies, contributing to its ecological significance.
